name: Wernher
detailed_location: Radio tower(Into The Pitt)Wernher's hideout(Free Labor)

topics.topic_text: How's research coming on the cure?
topics.response_text: I got folks working on it, 24/7. It'd go faster if they didn't keep fussing about not hurting the little squirt.{Grudging towards the complainers}

topics.topic_text: How's everything going in The Pitt?
topics.response_text: Oh, things are fine. Don't let any grumblers tell you differently!{Slick and untrustworthy}

topics.topic_text: What's going to happen to the baby?
topics.response_text: Oh, it'll be fine. I can take care of extracting the full cure from it, and meanwhile the slaves can raise it as one of their own.{Obviously doesn't care about the baby}

topics.topic_text: I guess there's no other option. Goodbye, Wernher.
topics.response_text: You're just going to be their tool right up to the bloody end, aren't you? Bye-bye, tool.{Amused at the player's foolishness, and looking forward to killing him.}

topics.topic_text: Wernher, how about saving us both a lot of trouble and leaving quietly?
topics.response_text: Oh, I see how it is. You signed on with Ashur, and now you're going to stand by your man. Maybe trying to catch his eye and be his queen?{Disgusted and mocking the player}

topics.topic_text: I came because of the radio message. What's the problem?
topics.response_text: Well now, a hero! Look at you.

topics.topic_text: Did you escape or something?
topics.response_text: Yeah. That's why these guys were after me. As long as I know about the cure, I'm a threat. So I ran.

topics.topic_text: Wait, slow down. Cure for what?
topics.response_text: The Pitt is a mess. Nearly everyone who lives there is either sick, dying, or... worse. It's the water. And the air. You can't escape it.

topics.topic_text: A cure? You're sick? Agh! Get away!
topics.response_text: It's not like that. You can't catch it from me. The Pitt... it gets to you. It's the water, and the air. You can't escape it.

topics.topic_text: Weren't you in a hurry? Storytime is over.
topics.response_text: Fine. Well, everyone is sick. All of us. The bosses too. Everyone who lives in The Pitt is sick. It's the city it... changes you.

topics.topic_text: If your people need you, what are you doing here?
topics.response_text: I'm on the run from our dead friends over there. As soon as I found out about the cure, they came after me.

topics.topic_text: What's wrong with your people?
topics.response_text: To put it simply: we're slaves. We're some of the only healthy survivors, but we're forced to work like animals.

topics.topic_text: The radio message said something about a reward. Let's skip to that part.
topics.response_text: Well, look at you, Moneybags. Right down to business. Gotta respect that.

topics.topic_text: I'm a better fighter than you, that's who. Can't you handle a couple Raiders?
topics.response_text: Yeah, whatever. I didn't come to DC to swap insults with Wasters. You want to flap gums, fine. But don't waste my time.

topics.topic_text: Yeah, fine. I was just kidding.
topics.response_text: You're a real joker, aren't you? Whatever. Listen, I come from a place called The Pitt.  It's a city far to the northwest.

topics.topic_text: What? It's not my fault you can't shoot straight.
topics.response_text: You're a real joker, aren't you? Whatever. Shut up and listen. I come from a place called The Pitt. It's a city far to the northwest.

topics.topic_text: I remember hearing about The Pitt from a guy in the Citadel.
topics.response_text: The Citadel, huh? That's the Brotherhood of Steel fortress, right? Yeah, I know about those guys.

topics.topic_text: Your plans are over, Wernher. Ashur knows everything.
topics.response_text: And you just went along with him, did you? To hell with everyone else but you, huh?

topics.topic_text: You never told me it meant kidnapping!
topics.response_text: Oh, boo-fucking-hoo. You don't think bringing those bastards down is worth getting your hands dirty?{Mocking the player's squeamishness ("wah" at the beginning is a mockery of a baby's cry of "waaaah!")}

topics.topic_text: She's here, but you never told me this meant kidnapping.
topics.response_text: Yeah, because you would have just whined about it. If you aren't getting your hands dirty, you aren't making a difference. Welcome to the world.{Irritated that the player is being a wimp about things}

topics.topic_text: It's here and safe. How's this going to put me in charge of The Pitt?
topics.response_text: Think of it as clearing the stage. The cure in this brat's genes is the only thing worth keeping, and now we can wipe that hellhole clean.

topics.topic_text: Sounds good. Let's finish this.
topics.response_text: That's the spirit. Just stick with the plan, and everything'll work out fine.

topics.topic_text: That wasn't the deal, Wernher. I'm having second thoughts about all of this.
topics.response_text: Oh, sure. You'll just march back to Ashur and his venomous little wifey, and say, "Sorry I stole your firstborn. My mistake!"

topics.topic_text: Sure, fine, whatever. Let's get this over with.
topics.response_text: That's the spirit. Nobody likes a quitter.{Talking up the player's nerve}

topics.topic_text: I guess you're right, since I already killed his wife.
topics.response_text: See? You're stuck on this path, pal. Might as well see it through to the end.

topics.topic_text: How am I supposed to do that?
topics.response_text: Simple: get someone else to do it for you. And there's a whole city full of Trogs hungry to do the job.

topics.topic_text: Sounds like fun. Let me at 'em!
topics.response_text: Whoa, there! Sweet as the thought is, you can't just kill 'em all yourself! You're just one man. You might miss a few!{Bloodthirsty, but playing the last line as a joke. }

topics.topic_text: I wiped out a lot of them, already. Isn't the job already done?
topics.response_text: You cocky bastard. Think you killed all of Ashur's little psychos? No way! Not even close!{Amused at the player's arrogance}

topics.topic_text: Sounds dangerous. How about helping a lady out?
topics.response_text: Sorry, doll, but I'll be busy setting everything up with the squirt, here. But for you, I guess I can spare a few supplies.

topics.topic_text: Sounds like a plan. How do I kill the lights?
topics.response_text: You can get to the power plant from a manhole down in the Steelyard. It's near the train tracks -- you can't miss it.

topics.topic_text: As long as the slaves are free and Marie is safe.
topics.response_text: Yeah, yeah, everybody's happy. Midea says she'll take care of the kid, when she's not too busy with everything else. Don't worry about it.{Uninterested in the kid.}

topics.topic_text: I expect my reward, now.
topics.response_text: Keep your shirt on, I'm getting to that! And I promise, you're getting plenty!

topics.topic_text: That leaves me as the new Lord of The Pitt.
topics.response_text: Yeah, but it's gonna take work to clean up after the riots. I can take care of the day-to-day stuff - you just reap the benefits, huh?{Wernher just likes being effectively in charge of The Pitt, and is basically buying off the player}

topics.topic_text: So, what do I do, now?
topics.response_text: Whatever you want, boss. I'll be whipping folks back into shape, and Midea's keeping an eye on the brat, so you can come and go as you like.

topics.topic_text: So I freed the slaves. Why isn't everyone cheering?
topics.response_text: It's not that easy. This is still our home, and there's still lots of work to be done. Killing Ashur is just the first step.

topics.topic_text: Oh, good. I love surprises. What is it?
topics.response_text: Relax. It's not about you. It's about your... companion.

topics.topic_text: If that's how it has to be, I understand.
topics.response_text: Yeah. That's the way it is. You can hook up with her again when you get back.

topics.topic_text: You're sure she can't come?
topics.response_text: Yeah. I'm sure. You can hook up with her again when you get back.

topics.topic_text: This doesn't sound good.
topics.response_text: Relax. It's not about you. It's about your... companion.

topics.topic_text: You sure I can't sneak a weapon in?
topics.response_text: Well... you might be able to get a small gun or a knife past them if you conceal it just right.

topics.topic_text: I'll take the gun.
topics.response_text: Okay. Here you go. Don't take it out until you get past the gate. You clear on what you need to do?

topics.topic_text: Gimme the knife.
topics.response_text: Okay. Here you go. Don't take it out until you get past the gate. You clear on what you need to do?

topics.topic_text: Nevermind. I'm fine without it.
topics.response_text: Yeah, probably for the best. Are you clear on what you need to do?

topics.topic_text: Get in. Find Midea. Got it.
topics.response_text: That's it. Good luck. We're counting on you.

topics.topic_text: Yeah, but I don't think I trust you.
topics.response_text: It's a bit too late for that now, isn't it? Either way, good luck. We're counting on you.

topics.topic_text: Ah! Where did you come from?
topics.response_text: I followed you. I've gotten very good at staying out of sight when I don't want to be seen.

topics.topic_text: I had a couple of questions first.
topics.response_text: Oh yeah? What is it?

topics.topic_text: All right, I'll meet you over by the tunnel.
topics.response_text: Whatever you say, hero. Just don't take too long. We need to get started. This ain't a short trip.

topics.topic_text: What do we need to do first?
topics.response_text: Well, you might try a disguise. They probably won't let some random armed Waster past the gates.

topics.topic_text: Yeah, a disguise is a good idea. I'll do that.
topics.response_text: Okay. You go get the outfit. I'll stay here and meet up with you when it's done.

topics.topic_text: Disguise or not, I should rescue those slaves.
topics.response_text: Whatever. Just get the outfit off of one of them while you're playing hero. I'll stay here and meet up with you when it's done.

topics.topic_text: I don't need a disguise. I'll find a way in.
topics.response_text: Hrm. Well... that's not the best idea, but at this point, I'm pretty much out of options, so if that's how it has to be...

topics.topic_text: What's your goal?
topics.response_text: The city is controlled by a man named Ashur. He's powerful. No one there dares go against him. No one except me.

topics.topic_text: Why can't you do it?
topics.response_text: They know that I know about the cure. All of them will be looking for me by now. That's why those guys came all the way here.

topics.topic_text: What am I trying to get?
topics.response_text: It's the key to a cure for the mutations. Everyone in The Pitt is mutated in some way. Some are just sick, some are... worse.

topics.topic_text: What do you need me to do?
topics.response_text: I need to you find a Slave Outfit so we can sneak you into The Pitt. I had to ditch mine whenever I ran for it.

topics.topic_text: I have to go.
topics.response_text: Good.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about your people.
topics.response_text: The city is built on the backs of slaves. We're diseased, and suffering. What else do you want to know?

topics.topic_text: Who's in charge of The Pitt?
topics.response_text: He's a guy named Ashur. I don't know where he came from, but he's strong enough that he keeps all the other bosses in line.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: You got it, Hero.

topics.topic_text: Is there anyone helping you free your people?
topics.response_text: Midea. She's another slave, like me. She's helping to organize them. She'll know when it's time.

topics.topic_text: Where do your people come from?
topics.response_text: Some of us are native to The Pitt, most of us are, really. People sometimes have kids before the sickness takes them.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about The Pitt.
topics.response_text: What do you want to know about it?

topics.topic_text: What happens to people who get sick?
topics.response_text: It's hard to describe. It's nasty. And it affects everyone a little differently. But the longer you're there, the more it gets you.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: You got it, Hero.

topics.topic_text: How did the city get started?
topics.response_text: After the war, the place just turns into a shithole. The buildings start falling over and the sickness makes people just turn on each other.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about what the Brotherhood did.
topics.response_text: Well, as bad as The Pitt is, it used to be worse. Much worse. It was complete chaos. Every man for himself.

topics.topic_text: Who lives there?
topics.response_text: The city is built on the backs of slaves. My people. We're diseased, and suffering.

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Thank you for your help with those guys. They finally tracked me down... I thought I'd have more time.

topics.topic_text: SpeechChallengeFailure
topics.response_text: No, I don't think so. You may not have the guts to change The Pitt, but I sure do.

conversation.response_text: Come on, we're almost there. It's just past this gate.
Here come more of them! Watch out!
Hang on. Someone's coming. Let me do the talking.
Hey, hey! What are you guys doing here?
Yeah? Well, I guess that's the difference between us. I have a lot of guts. You don't.
Jump on the cart. I'm right behind you.

description:
Wernher is a 30 year-old Caucasian Male.

A cunning former Pitt raider lieutenant who was stripped of his rank and enslaved after attempting to overthrow Ashur. Now working as an organizer of the slave revolt, he seeks an outsider's help to infiltrate the raiders and overthrow Ashur.

Wernher's Personality: Intelligent, manipulative, and opportunistic. Wernher presents himself as a concerned slave while hiding his past as a raider lieutenant responsible for maintaining slavery. He is cunning but transparent in his ambitions to seize power for himself.

Wernher's Backstory: Wernher was born around 2247, around the time of the Scourge. He rose to become Ashur's second-in-command in the Pitt, one of the more intelligent individuals in the city. However, his ambition led him to attempt a coup against Ashur, which failed. As punishment, he was stripped of his rank and reduced to slavery, forced to work alongside the slaves he once ruled. Determined to regain power, Wernher began organizing a slave rebellion in secret, collaborating with Midea, the de facto leader of slaves.
